extendedIngredients.name: bananas
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup bananas, ripe and mashed, about 2 large bananas

recipes.title: Banana chocolate chip cookies

winePairing.pairingText: Cookies can be paired with Cream Sherry, Madeira, and Prosecco. Sweet bubbly Prosecco doesn't overwhelm simple sugar or shortbread cookies, a sweet cream sherry complements spiced cookies, and madeira's nutty notes match cookies with nuts perfectly. One wine you could try is NV Solera Cream Sherry. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 375F. Line two cookie sheets with unbleached parchment paper and set aside.In a large mixing bowl add all the ingredients and mix well. With a medium cookie scoop drop cookie batter onto the lined cookie sheets a few inches apart. Flatten them slightly with the palm of your hand and bake for 10 minutes.Let them cool on the baking sheet for five minutes. Store in an air tight container for up to 2 days.

steps.step: Preheat the oven to 375F. Line two cookie sheets with unbleached parchment paper and set aside.In a large mixing bowl add all the ingredients and mix well. With a medium cookie scoop drop cookie batter onto the lined cookie sheets a few inches apart. Flatten them slightly with the palm of your hand and bake for 10 minutes.
Let them cool on the baking sheet for five minutes. Store in an air tight container for up to 2 days.
